1.name: Spider-Man 3
1.description: A strange black entity from another world bonds with Peter Parker and causes inner turmoil as he contends with new villains, temptations, and revenge.

2.name: Zodiac
2.description: In the late 1960s/early 1970s, a San Francisco cartoonist becomes an amateur detective obsessed with tracking down the Zodiac Killer, an unidentified individual who terrorizes Northern California with a killing spree.

3.name: No Country for Old Men
3.description: Violence and mayhem ensue after a hunter stumbles upon a drug deal gone wrong and more than two million dollars in cash near the Rio Grande.

4.name: Transformers
4.description: An ancient struggle between two Cybertronian races, the heroic Autobots and the evil Decepticons, comes to Earth, with a clue to the ultimate power held by a teenager.

5.name: Shooter
5.description: A marksman living in exile is coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the President. Ultimately double-crossed and framed for the attempt, he goes on the run to find the real killer and the reason he was set up.

6.name: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
6.description: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

7.name: Superbad
7.description: Two co-dependent high school seniors are forced to deal with separation anxiety after their plan to stage a booze-soaked party goes awry.

8.name: Into the Wild
8.description: After graduating from Emory University, top student and athlete Christopher McCandless abandons his possessions, gives his entire $24,000 savings account to charity and hitchhikes to Alaska to live in the wilderness. Along the way, Christopher encounters a series of characters that shape his life.

9.name: There Will Be Blood
9.description: A story of family, religion, hatred, oil and madness, focusing on a turn-of-the-century prospector in the early days of the business.

10.name: Hot Fuzz
10.description: A skilled London police officer is transferred to a small town with a dark secret.

11.name: Atonement
11.description: Fledgling writer Briony Tallis, as a thirteen-year-old, irrevocably changes the course of several lives when she accuses her older sister's lover of a crime he did not commit.

12.name: Death Proof
12.description: Two separate sets of voluptuous women are stalked at different times by a scarred stuntman who uses his "death proof" cars to execute his murderous plans.

13.name: Ratatouille
13.description: A rat who can cook makes an unusual alliance with a young kitchen worker at a famous restaurant.

14.name: Stardust
14.description: In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.

15.name: American Gangster
15.description: An outcast New York City cop is charged with bringing down Harlem drug lord Frank Lucas, whose real life inspired this partly biographical film.

16.name: Sunshine
16.description: A team of international astronauts are sent on a dangerous mission to reignite the dying Sun with a nuclear fission bomb in 2057.

17.name: Gone Baby Gone
17.description: Two Boston area detectives investigate a little girl's kidnapping, which ultimately turns into a crisis both professionally and personally.

18.name: Death at a Funeral
18.description: Chaos ensues when a man tries to expose a dark secret regarding a recently deceased patriarch of a dysfunctional British family.

19.name: Live Free or Die Hard
19.description: John McClane and a young hacker join forces to take down master cyber-terrorist Thomas Gabriel in Washington D.C.

20.name: The Mist
20.description: A freak storm unleashes a species of bloodthirsty creatures on a small town, where a small band of citizens hole up in a supermarket and fight for their lives.

21.name: Hairspray
21.description: Pleasantly plump teenager Tracy Turnblad teaches 1962 Baltimore a thing or two about integration after landing a spot on a local TV dance show.

22.name: Knocked Up
22.description: For fun-loving party animal Ben Stone, the last thing he ever expected was for his one-night stand to show up on his doorstep eight weeks later to tell him she's pregnant with his child.

23.name: The Golden Compass
23.description: In a parallel universe, young Lyra Belacqua journeys to the far North to save her best friend and other kidnapped children from terrible experiments by a mysterious organization.

24.name: Across the Universe
24.description: The music of The Beatles and the Vietnam War form the backdrop for the romance between an upper-class American girl and a poor Liverpudlian artist.

25.name: I Am Legend
25.description: Years after a plague kills most of humanity and transforms the rest into monsters, the sole survivor in New York City struggles valiantly to find a cure.

26.name: Enchanted
26.description: A young maiden in a land called Andalasia, who is prepared to be wed, is sent away to New York City by an evil queen, where she falls in love with a lawyer.

27.name: The Heartbreak Kid
27.description: A newly wed man who believes he's just gotten hitched to the perfect woman encounters another lady on his honeymoon.

28.name: Fracture
28.description: An attorney intent on climbing the career ladder toward success, finds an unlikely opponent in a manipulative criminal he is trying to prosecute.

29.name: The Bourne Ultimatum
29.description: Jason Bourne dodges a ruthless C.I.A. official and his Agents from a new assassination program while searching for the origins of his life as a trained killer.

30.name: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
30.description: A mature Queen Elizabeth endures multiple crises late in her reign including court intrigues, an assassination plot, the Spanish Armada, and romantic disappointments.

31.name: Juno
31.description: Faced with an unplanned pregnancy, an offbeat young woman makes an unusual decision regarding her unborn child.

32.name: National Treasure: Book of Secrets
32.description: Benjamin Gates must follow a clue left in John Wilkes Booth's diary to prove his ancestor's innocence in the assassination of Abraham Lincoln.

33.name: 28 Weeks Later
33.description: Six months after the rage virus was inflicted on the population of Great Britain, the US Army helps to secure a small area of London for the survivors to repopulate and start again. But not everything goes according to plan.

34.name: Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street
34.description: The infamous story of Benjamin Barker, aka Sweeney Todd, who sets up a barber shop in London which is the basis for a sinister partnership with his fellow tenant, Mrs. Lovett.

35.name: Pirates of the Caribbean: At World's End
35.description: Captain Barbossa, Will Turner and Elizabeth Swann must sail off the edge of the map, navigate treachery and betrayal, find Jack Sparrow, and make their final alliances for one last decisive battle.

36.name: Good Luck Chuck
36.description: In order to keep the woman of his dreams from falling for another guy, Charlie Logan has to break the curse that has made him wildly popular with single women: Sleep with Charlie once, and the next man you meet will be your true love.

37.name: Ocean's Thirteen
37.description: Danny Ocean rounds up the boys for a third heist, after casino owner Willy Bank double-crosses one of the original eleven, Reuben Tishkoff.

38.name: Grindhouse
38.description: Quentin Tarantino and Robert Rodriguez's homage to exploitation double features in the 60s and 70s with two back-to-back cult films that include previews of coming attractions between them.

39.name: Mr. Brooks
39.description: A well-respected businessman is sometimes controlled by his murder and mayhem-loving alter ego.

40.name: Funny Games
40.description: Two psychopathic young men take a family hostage in their cabin.

41.name: Eastern Promises
41.description: A Russian teenager living in London who dies during childbirth leaves clues to a midwife in her journal that could tie her child to a rape involving a violent Russian mob family.

42.name: Bridge to Terabithia
42.description: A preteen's life turns upside down when he befriends the new girl in school and they imagine a whole new fantasy world to escape reality.

43.name: Hostel: Part II
43.description: Three American college students studying abroad are lured to a Slovakian hostel, and discover the grim reality behind it.

44.name: P.S. I Love You
44.description: A young widow discovers that her late husband has left her 10 messages intended to help ease her pain and start a new life.

45.name: The Girl Next Door
45.description: Based on the Jack Ketchum novel of the same name, The Girl Next Door follows the unspeakable torture and abuses committed on a teenage girl in the care of her aunt...and the boys who witness and fail to report the crime.

46.name: Wild Hogs
46.description: A group of suburban biker wannabes looking for adventure hit the open road, but get more than they bargained for when they encounter a New Mexico gang called the Del Fuegos.

47.name: Planet Terror
47.description: After an experimental bio-weapon is released, turning thousands into zombie-like creatures, it's up to a rag-tag group of survivors to stop the infected and those behind its release.

48.name: Hitman
48.description: A gun-for-hire known only as Agent 47 hired by a group known only as 'The Organization' is ensnared in a political conspiracy, which finds him pursued by both Interpol and the Russian military as he treks across Russia and Eastern Europe.

49.name: Exhibit A
49.description: The timely story of a normal family disintegrating under financial pressure, eventually driven to the unimaginable. We witness the terrifying events unfold through daughter Judith's video camera, which subsequently becomes Exhibit A.

50.name: The Assassination of Jesse James by the Coward Robert Ford
50.description: Robert Ford, who's idolized Jesse James since childhood, tries hard to join the reforming gang of the Missouri outlaw, but gradually becomes resentful of the bandit leader.
